message.content:
cs.DC, cs.GT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with distributed algorithms for fair resource allocation problems, which are typically studied in the areas of distributed computing (cs.DC), game theory (cs.GT), networking and internet architecture (cs.NI), control systems (cs.SY), and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper specifically focuses on weighted $\alpha$-fair packing problems, which are optimization problems with linear constraints, and provides a distributed algorithm with convergence guarantees. The algorithm is stateless and allows for asynchronous updates, which are common features in distributed computing and networking. Therefore, cs.DC and cs.NI are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the structural properties of $\alpha$-fair allocations, which are relevant to game theory and machine learning. Therefore, cs.GT and cs.LG are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper deals with fairness guarantees, which are relevant to control systems. Therefore, cs.SY is also a likely sub-category.
